DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study enhance medical knowledge cause future coronary problem . Many study patient already experience coronary problem point danger associate plaque rich cholesterol . This study determine near-infrared method detection fatty plaques predict future event . If dangerous plaque identify , many treatment already available could test ability prevent coronary event .
DOC.criteria: General Subjects present coronary angiography IVUS image likely perform clinical purpose . Greater 18 year age . Clinical presenting symptom meet one three criterion : 1 . Subjects present acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) include least one following : 1 . Elevated cardiac biomarkers CKMB troponin great upper limit normal ; 2 . ST depression ST elevation > 1mm 2 contiguous lead absence LVH , pace rhythm , BBB early repolarization ; 3 . A stabilized patient 24 72 hour post STEMI ; 2 . Unstable angina pectoris ; 3 . Stable angina pectoris and/or positive functional study evidence ischemia . Angiographic Inclusion Criteria At least one Suspected Index Culprit Lesion require image IVUS and/or NIRS clinical indication . At least two native epicardial coronary artery ( may include Suspected Index Culprit Artery ) eligible image NIRSIVUS . IVUS/NIRS Imaging Inclusion Criterion A minimum total 50 mm coronary artery involve prior Index Procedure PCI ( include 5mm border either edge site receive PCI ) must scan . This 50mm total length may include contribution Suspected Index Culprit Arteries Index NonCulprit Arteries . This total length must include contribution two native imaged artery . Unstable patient ( STEMI within prior 24 hour ; cardiogenic shock , hypotension need inotropes , hypoxia need intubation , IABP ) patient procedural complication ( coronary dissection , perforation complication would necessitate immediateunplanned revascularization ) index PCI procedure . History CABG plan CABG within 6 month follow NIRSIVUS image . Patient additional lesion ( ) need staged PCI . Subject life expectancy le 2 year time index catheterization . Subject ejection fraction ( EF ) < 30 % . Subject pacemaker dependent/paced rhythm . Subject pregnant lactating . Any factor investigator feel would put patient increase risk otherwise make patient unsuitable participation protocol Patients undergoing performance PCI three major vessel index PCI .
